meanings.definition: A position on a scale of intensity or amount.
meanings.sent1: She reached the highest levels of excitement when she won the game.
meanings.sent2: The water in the glass was at different levels due to the uneven surface.
meanings.sent3: The competition for the top levels of the leaderboard was fierce.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to his work reached new levels of commitment.
meanings.sent5: The levels of happiness in the room were palpable.

meanings.sent1: The carpenter carefully measured the levels of the floor before laying the tiles.
meanings.sent2: The table had multiple levels for storing different items.
meanings.sent3: The cake on the levels of the stand looked tempting.
meanings.sent4: The levels of the parking lot were clearly marked for easy navigation.
meanings.sent5: The levels of the building provided stunning views of the city.

meanings.definition: To make something flat or even.
meanings.sent1: She levels the cake batter in the pan before putting it in the oven.
meanings.sent2: The construction worker levels the ground before starting to build.
meanings.sent3: He levels the playing field by ensuring fair rules for all.
meanings.sent4: The gardener levels the soil to prepare for planting.
meanings.sent5: The teacher levels the posters on the wall for a neat display.

meanings.definition: To progress to a higher or lower position.
meanings.sent1: The hiker levels up the mountain with determination.
meanings.sent2: The elevator levels down to the ground floor for passengers to exit.
meanings.sent3: His mood levels down after hearing the disappointing news.
meanings.sent4: The athlete levels up in the competition with each successful match.
meanings.sent5: The river levels down after days of heavy rain.
